intro: Grewia aldabrensis, commonly known as the Aldabra grewia, is a shrub native to the Comoros Islands and Madagascar. It is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spikes, which bloom during the rainy season. Its fruit is a small, hairy drupe that contains a single seed. Grewia aldabrensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
